result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:05 pm - Def in court.   
Def has been applying for work with Olsten's.  Hoping to be work by next week.  Going to AA weekly.  Completed most of DV groups.  Good participation.  
CT:  Def to analyze the decision points from the incident in the criminal complaint and what different decisions could have been made.  Def to put this in writing. 
Add 10 hours CS per week until employment starting this week. 
Def has been babysitting grandson.  
REV:  12/8/15 @ 4pm (SLH)

4:32 pm - Def in court.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No violations.  Not employed.  Seeking employment.  Seeing Mr. Taylor.  
CT:  Will be adding community service if not employed by next review hearing.  
Rev: 8/25/15 @ 4pm (SLH)
Probation review hearing on June 16, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Def P
Def: have 4 job searches/week & turn them in for unemployment
PRH: 5/12 @ 4
Domestic Violence Review

4:10 pm - Def in court.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Def sees Mark Taylor - has had 2 sessions.  Seeing him weekly. 
On waiting list of Batterer's Group
REV:  3/3/15 @ 4pm (SLH)

4:03 pm - Def in court.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Drinking violation - def has been clean since that time - over 60 days.
AODA completed - on monitoring - hasn't gone to treatment.  
Needs to call back tomorrow for an appointment. 
CT:  Go out in the hallway to call and recall case. 
4:17 pm - Recalled - same appearance
Appointment scheduled for Monday w/Jameson.  
CT:  Issues should have been March or April since the AODA was completed in March.  You know what the conditions are and need to comply. I expect you to be attending treatment. 
Def living with the victim.  Def has been referred to Batterer's Program.  
Rev:  1/27/15 @ 4pm (SLH)
CT:  To be seeing Mike Jameson and attending as recommended.  Should be in for DV group.  
Def completed Thinking 4 a Change - Trebelhorn said that would be in lieu of DV group. 
CT:  I don't think so.  That doesn't satisfy the DV group requirement.   I can't believe you are trying that. 
Court reads JOC to def.
for interpreter Patty McCutcheon for $490.00 (two cases 13CF833/14CF563); sent to Finance 10/24/14.
JS Sentence Violation - ORDER TO DETAIN SIGNED BY SLH (Capias entered & filed in 13CF833)

Interpreter Confirmation
assigned PO Rebecca Johnson

10:20 am Def in court w/Atty Sean William O'Neill.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Patricia McCutchen-interpreter sworn for the Ms. Pittman who's present in court.
O'Neill sites plea agreement.  No contest on 833 due to civil liability.  Plea Questionnarie filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
13CF-833  Count 1 - Misd Battery  NO CONTEST.  Count 2  Dismissed but read-in
14CF-563  Count 2 - Misd. Battery  GUILTY.  Counts 1 & 3  DIsmissed but read-in
Rights/elements gone over.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Rights F & V waived.  Factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Ms. Pittman would like him to come home.  Needs help at home.
Keller recommends probation with 90 days CJ on em.  Some jail time is appropriate here based on the seriousness...  O'Neill feels this is an appropriate resolution.  He's going to treatment at Right Way.  He's contrite when it comes to the situation with Elaine.  Asks for 18 mos CJ.  He's committed to Elaine long term.  He abided by the no contact but it was very difficult.  He does have a job.  Bailey comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCES withheld on each count
18 mos probation - concurrent
13CF-833 - 90 days CJ jail on em through JSS w/ 6 days credit
Domestic violence assessment and follow through with recommendations
AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations
No alcohol
Random testing
No contact with Jeff Beatty and Nicole Helgerson; the victims in 13CF-833
No contact with Ms. Pittman up to agent
Restutution in 13CF-833 to be held open for 60 days
CC and DOC fees

11:12 am    Def in court w/Atty Sean Michael O'Neill.  Michelle Ann Keller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  9/26 at 2:30 pm     STC:  10/30 at 10 am  SLH
Keller:  The victim is present and asking that the no contact be lifted.  The State object to complete contact.  The victim can't hear so phone contact is difficult.  We wouldn't object to contact by letter.  The victim would prefer to put something in writing.  O'Neill:  This is a misdemeanor.  Asks the court for contact in public places and with a counselor and written contact.  I think this case will be resolved soon.  Keller:  The victim would prefer to put something in writing at a later date.  The victim's friends say she's afraid for her safety.  There's much more than what's in the complaint.  COURT will allow contact by letter and at counseling.
Directing Law enforcement assistance
